batch.description: process only a subset of the pile ups. <pile-up-ids> is a comma-separated list of <idx-spec>. Each <id-specifications> is either a single integer <idx> or a range <from>..<to>. <idx>, <from> and <to> are zero-based indices into the pile up DB. The range is right-open, i.e. index <to> is excluded. <to> may be a dollar-sign (`$`) to indicate the end of the pile up DB.

min-anchor-length.description: alignment need to have at least this length of unique anchoring sequence (default: 500)

min-reads-per-pile-up.description: pile ups must have at least <ulong> reads to be processed (default: 3)

bad-fraction.description: Intrinsic QVs are categorized as "bad" if they are greater or equal to the best QV of the worst <frac> trace point intervals. (default: 0.8)

revert.description: revert named option to default value. This is useful to revert specific options of a config file.

m.description: Dazzler masks for repetitive regions (at least one required; generate with `mask-repetitive-regions` command)

A.description: use <num-threads> threads for auxiliary tools like `daligner`, `damapper` and `daccord` (default: floor(totalCpus / <threads>) )

proper-alignment-allowance.description: An alignment is called proper if it is end-to-end with at most <num> bp allowance. (default: trace point spacing of alignment)

v.description: increase output to help identify problems; use up to three times. Warning: performance may be drastically reduced if using three times.

max-chain-gap.description: two local alignments may only be chained if at most <bps> of sequence in the A-read and B-read are unaligned. (default: 10000)

max-indel.description: two local alignments may only be chained if the resulting insertion or deletion is at most <bps> (default: 1000)

min-score.description: output chains with a score of at least <int> (default: trace point spacing of alignment)

q.description: reduce output as much as possible reporting only fatal errors. If given this option overrides --verbose.

min-relative-score.description: output chains with a score of at least <fraction> of the best chains score. A value of 1.0 means that only chains with the best chains score will be accepted; a value of 0.0 means that all chains will be accepted (default: 1.0)

max-alignment-error.description: local alignments may have an error rate of no more than <double> (default: 0.30)

k.description: keep the temporary files; outputs the exact location

keep-temp.description: keep the temporary files; outputs the exact location

reads.description: set of PacBio reads in .db/.dam format

e.description: local alignments may have an error rate of no more than <double> (default: 0.30)

b.description: process only a subset of the pile ups. <pile-up-ids> is a comma-separated list of <idx-spec>. Each <id-specifications> is either a single integer <idx> or a range <from>..<to>. <idx>, <from> and <to> are zero-based indices into the pile up DB. The range is right-open, i.e. index <to> is excluded. <to> may be a dollar-sign (`$`) to indicate the end of the pile up DB.

only.description: only process/output insertions of the given type. Note, extending insertions are experimental and may produce invalid results. (default: spanning)

verbose.description: increase output to help identify problems; use up to three times. Warning: performance may be drastically reduced if using three times.

max-relative-overlap.description: two local alignments may only be chained if the overlap between them is at most <fraction> times the size of the shorter local alignment. This must hold for the reference and query. (default: 0.30)

auxiliary-threads.description: use <num-threads> threads for auxiliary tools like `daligner`, `damapper` and `daccord` (default: floor(totalCpus / <threads>) )

mask.description: Dazzler masks for repetitive regions (at least one required; generate with `mask-repetitive-regions` command)

aux-threads.description: use <num-threads> threads for auxiliary tools like `daligner`, `damapper` and `daccord` (default: floor(totalCpus / <threads>) )

allow-single-reads.description: allow using single reads instead of consensus sequence for gap closing
